channel.title: New Monitor
channel.description: So I was thinking of getting a big monitor tk use since my lapttop screen doesn't seem to satisfy my needs. Anyways I was going to get a Dell monitor and was wondering if an older monitor, made around the tine of windows XP would work if I attachd it to my windows 7 laptop. Would it work? Stupid question heh. Thanks for the help. So basically all I'm asking is if I can use an older monitor with a win7 laptop

item.title: New Monitor
item.dc:creator: @Acrodox Acrodox
item.description:
@Acrodox wrote:

Thanks to both of you.

Read full topic

item.title: New Monitor
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

The OS shouldn’t make a problem. As long as all the cords and stuff work and you have the ports you should be fine.

Read full topic

item.title: New Monitor
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

It depends… The old monitor would probably use a VGA or DVI connection.

Read full topic

item.title: New Monitor
item.dc:creator: @Acrodox Acrodox
item.description:
@Acrodox wrote:

Thanks mani apreciate it, what’s the Wire called that I would have to get in order to attach the monitor to my laptop

Read full topic

item.title: New Monitor
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

Its not Windows 7 you have to worry about. Can your laptop’s hardware support a legacy monitor. If your laptop has the right port to handle the monitor’s connection that I’m guessing it probably would.

Read full topic
